questions.question: How many degrees can owls turn their heads?
questions.incorrectMessage: Actually, owls can rotate their heads approximately 270 degrees!

questions.question: What is a group of owls called?
How tall is the tiniest owl in the world?
questions.incorrectMessage: The adult elf owl is only 5-6 inches tall and tips the scales at 1.5 oz!
questions.correctMessage: That's right! The adult elf owl is only 5-6 inches tall and tips the scales at 1.5 oz!

questions.question: What are baby owls are called?
questions.incorrectMessage: Baby owls are called owlets. (When in doubt always guess the cutest answer.)
questions.correctMessage: That's right! Baby owls are owlets.

questions.question: Some owls eat other owls. True or False?
questions.incorrectMessage: It's true. For example, the Great Horned Owls are the top predator of the smaller Barred Owl.

questions.question: How many toes do owls have on each foot?
questions.incorrectMessage: Nope. They've got 4 toes: two facing forwards and two facing backwards.
questions.correctMessage: That's right! (They've got 4 toes: two facing forwards and two facing backwards.)

questions.question: A burrowing owl makes a sound like what animal when threatened?
questions.incorrectMessage: The burrowing owl hisses and makes a rattling sound like a rattlesnake to try and frighten off predators.
questions.correctMessage: That's right! The burrowing owl hisses and makes a rattling sound like a rattlesnake to try and frighten off predators.

questions.question: What is the advantage of the facial disc on some owls?
questions.incorrectMessage: Sorry, that's wrong. The facial disc can amplify sounds up to 10 times by funneling sound waves to the owl's ears!
questions.correctMessage: Good job! The facial disc can amplify sounds up to 10 times by funneling sound waves to the owl's ears!

questions.question: Eastern screech owls can be found up and down the east coast of the US and how far west?
questions.incorrectMessage: They can be found all the way to the Rocky Mountains!
questions.correctMessage: That's right! And their habitat overlaps with the Western Screech Owl that far west.

questions.question: As a result of their tube-shaped eyes, what can an owl not do?
questions.incorrectMessage: Owls' eyes are fixed and they cannot focus on objects close to them.
questions.correctMessage: That's right! Now you know why owls need reading glasses and not bifocals.

messages.terrible: Hope you learned something about owls!
